summary: This is an internal email from August 7, 2020, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), discussing ongoing grand jury proceedings, charging documents, and investigative steps related to Jeffrey Epstein and Robert Hadden. It highlights coordination pressures and internal decision-making regarding evidence review from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: Reviewed the first draft of the Hadden prosecution memo; part of the legal team working on the case.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a potential Menedez DAG fight; awaiting her call or decision.

persons.name: GEP
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of paperwork being circulated, including a premises warrant; appears to be Jeffrey Epstein (initials GEP).

connections.description: Bekah is part of the legal team reviewing and preparing prosecution memos related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation
events.description: The RMI team is scheduled to go to the grand jury on Monday, August 10, 2020, with fraud having signed off on the charge and charging document.

events.title: Planned Grand Jury Presentation for Hadden
events.description: The team aims to go to the grand jury the week of August 24, 2020, for the Robert Hadden case, with time pressure to beat the District Attorney of New York (DANY).

keyFacts: The RMI team planned to present charges to a grand jury on August 10, 2020, with fraud approval for the charge and charging document.
A premises warrant for 'RG' was being prepared as part of the Epstein investigation paperwork.
The team was revising a prosecution memo for Robert Hadden, with Bekah having reviewed the first draft.
There was internal pressure to proceed with grand jury presentations for Hadden by August 24, 2020, to 'beat DANY' (District Attorney of New York).
The office was awaiting guidance on how to handle evidence from the SDFL Epstein investigation, specifically considering reviewing only 24 boxes of hard copy documents.
